No one needs to hunt? All the processed food and fast food is garbage and 
is horrible for you. Organic food is very expensive. Not to mention many of 
the foods we eat contain all kinds of weird chemicals that most of us 
couldn't pronounce. If the government can crush us that easily, why do they 
seem so intent on taking firearms away from law abiding citizens? If 
someone doesn't want to own a gun, whatever, they can just not buy one. But 
don't expect us to conform to your ideology or your lifestyle. The vast 
majority of gun owners such as myself simply own them because we like 
target shooting, shooting competitions, plinking tin cans, stuff like that. 
The great thing about a gun though is that we can defend ourselves from 
criminals more effectively than using knives, mace, or common household 
objects. The only knives we can legally carry are 3 inch folding knives. 
What's so intimidating about that? That means we have to get in even closer 
to our assailant in order to take him out. The guy could be wacked out of 
his mind on drugs for all we know. Most of the time when a gun is pulled 
out in a self defense situation, the other guy runs away. Now, does that 
mean that you should pull out a gun during a fist fight? No, not 
necessarily, unless he plans on beating you to death with his fists. If 
it's just a fist fight like the typical ones you see in schools and 
whatnot, then you don't need to. Now you might talk about accidental 
shootings, well that can be addressed accordingly with proper training and 
trigger discipline. Also, when your gun is not in use and/or has no 
business being out in the open, unload it, put it in a safe and lock it up. 
Especially if you have children. But if you like your hobby enough that you 
don't want to quit it, be sure to lock any and all firearms in a safe along 
with the ammunition. Be sure to give your children the training and 
discipline that they need in order to operate a firearm once they are 
mature enough. That way they'll know what it is, what it looks like, and 
what it can do if it is misused. And if you raise you kids right with good 
morals and values and that you really are 100% sure that they are of sound 
mind, you won't end up with the next Adam Lanza. Which was clearly a case 
of extreme irresponsibility on the mother's part.

comments.text:
+CrypticHeaven Hence my Turk example.. I have never had any reason to hate 
or like the Turks, hence how I react. There is no negative or positive, 
racial bias in that. The reason why I brought up bias was not only because 
of your misconception of the definition of racism, but because a sheltered 
man who has mainly seen white people all his life wont necessarily be, 
under your definition, racist.  Unless you develop a negative bias against 
a specific race, you have no reason to react differently to that race 
simply because they're different.

History is a good example of this. The Roman Empire cared only if you were 
Roman. They didn't care about race at all. In fact, an Arab, Philip the 
Arab, was able to rise to the rank of Praetorian Prefect (leader of the 
guard, basically), and eventually, Roman Emperor. There were multiple Popes 
born in Africa, such as Pope Gelasius I. A more modern example would be the 
various terrorist groups in the Middle East, like ISIS. They don't care 
about your race, they care about your beliefs. Despite their extremism, 
they aren't racist.

The thing is, racism exists because of stereotypes, and bias. When neither 
is present against a different race, then how could everyone be racist? 
Judging people is natural, everyone does it. However, people judge with 
reason. If they have no other reason to judge, other than that someone 
looks different, they usually wont judge. Racism wasn't even that common 
throughout history. It became common with the start of the slave trade in 
Africa as people needed a reason, especially as Christians to justify what 
they're doing. Even with the mistreatment of the Native Americans, the 
focus was less on their red skin and more on how "uncivilized" they were 
compared to Europeans.

A lot of what you were describing reminds me of the U.S. It's important to 
remember that Americans don't represent the world...While the American 
media and people like to put emphasis on race when such emphasis shouldn't 
exist, not every country does.
comments.author: Barrex912

comments.text:
+Barrex912 I understand that nobody infringed on my rights, although, the 
common advocacy against the right to be openly racist might as well 
infringe on them itself.
It's true that "racism" isn't the correct term for what I'm describing. 
However, racism is such a widely used buzzword that it's meaning has 
disfigured. This is likely due to the fact that racism & stereotypes often 
go hand in hand. Nowadays, the term can be applied to any person making a 
comment regarding race. Nonetheless, my point can be inferred and stands. 
People selflessly let race hinder their decisions & perception whether they 
do this consciously or unconsciously, & most people would refer to this 
type of bias as racism, whether it's the correct term or not.
comments.author: CrypticHeaven

comments.text:
+CrypticHeaven No one infringed on your rights. Actually, they're just 
judging you, which is exactly what racists, as well as everyone, do. No one 
said you can't be racist. You were just mocked for being racist. 

Racism is defined by www.oxforddictionaries.com as, "the belief that all 
members of each race possess characteristics or abilities specific to that 
race, especially so as to distinguish it as inferior or superior to another 
race or races." Saying that everyone is racist is simply untrue. A more 
correct statement would be that everyone judges others based on their own 
experiences, including media or just simple life experiences. It's called 
stereotyping, and bias, not simply racism.. The same is done with rednecks, 
the British, the Finnish, the Americans.. It is something that is done with 
everyone.

Do you know what racism even is? I have never throughout my life believed 
that your race defined how you are. What are your opinions about the Turks 
of Turkey? Do you hate them, like them, or don't care at all? They aren't 
even a race, yet are considered by many, mainly those effected by them in 
history like the Greeks and the Armenians, to be evil. I have never met a 
Turk ever, in my life. If I met one, knowing that they're a Turk, I may be 
interested in their nationality, however I would not judge them negatively 
because of their origins. Would you?

Basically, you have no idea what you're talking about. Assuming that quote 
represents your own beliefs, you confuse insults with forbiddance, and 
judging with racism. I'm sorry if I sounded rude, as my intent isn't to 
belittle you. I'd just like you to think about what you're saying before 
you say it, or in this case, quote it.

comments.text:
Because a population without teeth is completely at the mercy of the body 
governing them.  While that body stays benevolent, weapons of all kinds, 
including and beyond guns, merely exist as hypothetical insurance. 
 However, people are people.  Eventually someone wants power and 
manipulates the system to gain enough to challenge the existing order.  You 
can look at virtually every nation that has existed for evidence of that. 
 Rome is a great example of a limited democratic republic that devolved 
into a mob-ruled democracy that then welcomed a strong leader to give them 
security and order, converting it into a despotism.  England was a 
tumultuous country for centuries where the crown, the nobles, and the 
people were constantly at odds until the nobles basically lost their 
economic purpose during the industrial revolution.  At that point, it 
started gelling into the system that exists now out of necessity for 
stability.  Nothing is saying that existence is permanent.  France was 
similar, though more bloody because the mobs succeeded in outright 
overthrowing the existing system.  America had an incident during the civil 
war that ended up changing many fundamentals of the nation, both good and 
bad, but America is so young compared to anyone else, its history is not 
the best gauge.  Guns don't fix day to day problems.  They, like all 
weapons, simply give the power to change things.  The one that has the 
weapons has the power to enforce their will.  If it is a balancing system, 
as America was intended, where both the people and the government has their 
own types of access to weapons and the people can declaw a rogue government 
by refusing to fight for it and defending against its agents that do, then, 
in theory rogue governments can be put down with minimal loss.  In 
practice, though, it is always more complicated.  Especially when people go 
rogue themselves and have to be put down by the government and people 
expect the government to fix it.

captions.text:
• From a murder committed because the costume
looked too real to someone that killed their

whole family inspired by the movie titled
Halloween, we count 15 examples of death on

everyone's favourite creepy holiday
15 - Woodbridge Abductions,

• When you think of trick-or-treating, you're
thinking about kids running around the neighbourhood

in the middle of the night wearing costumes
and unsupervised - a situation that rapists

are happy to exploit
• In 2009, a few teenage girls from Virginia

went out trick-or-treating, only to get ambushed
by a gun-wielding maniac who sexually assaulted

two of the girls while the third called her
mother on her mobile phone - the rapist soon

fled
• It took two years for the police to track

the man down, by then known as the East Coast
Rapist responsible for endless counts of rape

in a 10 year period
14 - Poison Candy,

• A father gave his children candy on halloween,
but neglected to tell them he'd added an extra

ingredient - cyanide
• It was 1974, a Texas man had just taken

out a huge life insurance policy on his kids,
and so he thought it'd be a good idea to accelerate

his investment and just kill them off to get
the money

• Not only this, but he also gave the cyanide
candy to four other children, but the only

kid that died was his eight-year-old son who
swallowed it and died - the father was executed

for his crimes 10 years later
13 - Trick or Treat Murder,

• An ex-marine who split up with his wife
because she ended up with another woman, shot

when a trick-or-treater holding a gun showed
up at his door and fired

• His ex-wife left her lover and came back
to her husband, but not before the lover felt

scorned and so plotted with her friend to
kill the husband

• She chose halloween night because it wouldn't
look suspicious to see someone in a disguise

show up at someone's door, and the husband
died in his wife's arms on the hospital ride

back
12 - Pasadena Murders,

• Halloween night 1993, California, the
Bloods gang were cruising around looking to

retaliate for the murders by a rival gang
earlier in the night

• Instead they found three young teens who
they pulled guns on and brutally shot to death

for absolutely no reason - murdering the wrong
group and ending the lives of three innocent

teens
• It took a couple of years before those

members of the gang were found guilty of first-degree
murder

11 - Liske Family Murder,
• A 2010 case about an Ohio teenager who

just came home from church only to find his
brother, mother and step-father all bludgeoned

to death in the face
• This teen was traumatised, quoting that

he thought it was like something out a nightmare
or haunted house

• The murderer turned out to be a son from
the mother's previous marriage known with

a history of schizophrenia and violence - and
he never gave a motive behind his actions

10 - Skunk Attack,
• Sometimes it's hard to figure out what

someone's halloween costume is, but have you
ever been so jumpy that you unloaded a shotgun

into someone's face because you thought they
were a skunk?

• This 9-year-old girl had a relative that
thought so - he actually thought she was a

skunk and so pulled out his shotgun and fired
directly into her shoulder, arm, back and

neck
• Her costume was black, with a black hat

and a white tassel - and at no point did the
relative take a step back to say, actually,

I've never seen a skunk standing on its hind
legs - maybe I better NOT blow it off the

face of the Earth
9 - Party Murder,

• A 15-year-old girl called Martha Moxley
was at a Halloween party near her neighbours

house when the night didn't end the way she
expected - she was stripped partly naked and

beaten to death in the backyard
• It took almost 30 years for the killer,

Michael Skakel, to get a 20 year jail conviction
until he was released on bail in 2013 to await

a new trial
• It turns out he was the nephew of Robert

F. Kennedy's late wife, with some suggesting
that was the reason it took near 30 years

for justice to be served
8 - Taylor Van Diest,

• Halloween night 2011 - a girl waking through
the small neighbourhood of Armstrong, home

to only 5000 people when she was attacked
• She would later be found brutally beaten

and unconscious, dying from her injuries before
she could inform on her attackers identity

• She'd sent a text to her boyfriend mere
moments before getting attacked telling him

she was being creeped on - and DNA evidence
helped identify the murderer as Matthew Foerster

along with his father who helped cover up
the attack

7 - Accidental Hanging,
• More of a suicide than a murder - this

15 year old kid wanted to surprise friends
and family with a fake hanging for halloween,

but while preparing the trick he made a mistake
• The noose tightened around his neck and

the kid panicked, tightening it further - a
group of children later found his body hanging

in the closet with his neck to the side
• His grandfather tried to revive him but

he was well dead by the time a medical team
arrived

6 - Tony Bagley,
• A 7 year old kid trick or treating with

his family in Las Vegas dressed as a skeleton
- he was rounding a corner when a masked man

shot him, to which the kid later died of his
injuries

• No conviction was ever handed out, the
killer couldn't be found and the murder was

chalked up to random gang violence
• Sadly, the kids father was later incarcerated

for an unrelated incident of murder - he is
currently service two consecutive life sentences

5 - California Murders,
• Three girls exhausted from handing out

halloween candy all night, two of them went
upstairs to sleep and the third, Lauren, in

the first-floor bedroom
• Lauren was woken up by breaking glass

and screams - her first instinct was to run
outside, but she came back in when she saw

an intruder jumping out through the kitchen
window

• She went back upstairs to find her two
friends covered in blood and vicious wounds

through their body - they later died, but
the killer was later found when his blood

was found at the scene
4 - Halloween Movie,

• A 17 year old kid called Jake Evens who'd
watched the film Halloween one too many times

- he described the scene in which a young
boy murders his family with no remorse as

inspiration for his own crime
• He used a gun instead of a knife to ambush

his sister - he knocked on her door saying
their mom needed to talk to her, then he pulled

out a gun when her back was turned
• At first she thought he was joking, until

her plugged her full of shells and then went
downstairs to finish the job murdering his

own mother
• He later claimed his actions would haunt

him forever - as it should
3 - Law Change,

• Back in the day laws were more lax - kids
could walk around in the dead of night all

by themselves to trick or treat
• That all changed when a 9 year old girl

was abducted, raped and killed by a local
neighbour with her body dumped in a plastic

bag near a farm field
• Since then, that local area of Fond du

Lac schedules trick or treating only between
3:30pm to 5:30pm when it's still daylight

the Sunday before Halloween only accompanied
by parents

2 - Egg Murder,
• Halloween night, 1998, A 21 year old who

went out to pick up his girlfriend and her
son from a party

• In the car, he was assaulted by a pack
of kids who flung eggs - enraged, he jumped

out of his car door to speak to them
• Instead, one kid pulled out a gun and

shot the guy in the head - he died instantly
and the kid was never found

1 - Hanging Woman
• 2005, Halloween night, a 42 year old woman

commits suicide by hanging herself from a
public tree in Frederica, Delaware

• For hours, motorists would shrug off the
dead woman by thinking it was a halloween

prop - but after a while police were called
in to verify

• The woman lived a quarter mile from the
tree, and once they discovered it really was

a dead woman the police quietly removed her
body from the scene
